docs.snippet: Often the target of U.S. human rights accusations, China wasted little time returning such charges following the shooting at a historic black church in South Carolina that left nine people dead. Elsewhere around the world, the attack renewed perce...
docs.lead_paragraph: Often the target of U.S. human rights accusations, China wasted little time returning such charges following the shooting at a historic black church in South Carolina that left nine people dead. Elsewhere around the world, the attack renewed perceptions that Americans have too many guns and have yet to overcome racial tensions.

headline.main: World Shocked at Enduring Racism, Gun Violence in US
headline.print_headline: World Shocked at Enduring Racism, Gun Violence in US

docs.snippet: Somewhere out there are an admitted killer who crawled through a Texas prison's ventilation ducts, a murderer who apparently escaped from an Indiana institution in a garbage truck, and a Florida convict who got other inmates to put him in a crate ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Somewhere out there are an admitted killer who crawled through a Texas prison's ventilation ducts, a murderer who apparently escaped from an Indiana institution in a garbage truck, and a Florida convict who got other inmates to put him in a crate at the prison furniture shop and had himself delivered to freedom by truck.

headline.main: Across US, Over 220 Prison Escapees Listed as on the Loose

docs.snippet: After a 14-hour search, the suspect was caught some 200 miles away from the historic black church where nine people were killed....
docs.lead_paragraph: After a 14-hour search, the suspect was caught some 200 miles away from the historic black church where nine people were killed.
docs.abstract: Police arrest 21-year-old white man Dylann Storm Roof as suspect in shooting massacre of nine people in Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church in Charleston, SC; murders, which are being investigated as hate crime, leave people stunned and grieving; whites, blacks, Jews and Christians unite in city to declare that racist gunman will not split a proud community.

headline.main: Church Massacre Suspect Held as Charleston Grieves
headline.sub: Attack Is Called a Hate Crime
headline.print_headline: Charleston Massacre Suspect Held as City Grieves

keywords.name: organizations

byline.contributor: Nick Corasaniti reported from Charleston, Richard Pérez-Peña from New York and Lizette Alvarez from Miami. Reporting was contributed by John Eligon, Jason Horowitz, Jonathan Weisman and Alan Blinder from Charleston, Michael S. Schmidt and Michael D. Shear from Washington, and Jonathan M. Katz from Kings Mountain, N.C..
byline.original: By NICK CORASANITI, RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA and LIZETTE ALVAREZ
